Default is 30 (30000 milliseconds). This determines the maximum buffer size before starting to play the video. If you don't know what this is, don't change it.
Default is 15 (15000 milliseconds). Decrease this value to play video faster but there is a possibility that the player may fail or even crash. Change at your own risk.
Default is 2500 milliseconds. This represents the buffer size when SEEKING or UNPAUSING the video. Change this if you're not satisfied with the small delay when seeking video.

Reduce jittering by enabling framerate interpolation. Note that this will only be applied if the video sync option is set to one of the 'display' mode, otherwise it will be silently ignored. This may not work well in some cases.

Controls how mpv syncs the video, either to audio (default, recommended) or the display itself. Setting this to anything but 'audio' may cause issues on displays with high frame refresh rates (>60 FPS). Consider lowering your device's framerate accordingly.
Configures mpv capabilities according to one of the built-in profile presets. Default is 'fast' as it is phone-friendly. Using 'low-latency' can be good when streaming from live sources.
Show Custom Skip Button on Main Screen
Enabling this will display the custom 'Skip period' button, found in the 'Seek to Position' popup, on the main player screen between the rewind and fast-forward buttons for easier access.
The default skip duration is 90 seconds (1:30 minutes), which is ideal for anime. You can adjust this duration for the custom skip button here.

string-array.name: tips
string-array.item: For shared playlists to work, Syncplay needs to know where your media files are stored. Add your media folders in 'Settings > General > Media Directories for Shared Playlist'.
Want to use the video player solo? Select a player, tap the Syncplay logo above, then choose 'Offline Mode'.
You can always reset settings to their default states by going to 'Settings -> Advanced -> Reset to Default'
Joining the same room repeatedly? Save it as a shortcut on your device for one-tap access by clicking the small button next to 'Join Room'.
Each player has different strengths. If one doesn't work well with your video format, try another.
Syncplay Mobile allows you to play media from direct links. However, YouTube is NOT supported, yet.

Created managed room '%1$s' with password '%2$s'. Please save this information for future reference! It is copied to your clipboard so you can paste it elsewhere.

In managed rooms everyone is kept in sync with the room operator(s) who are the only ones who can pause, unpause, seek, and change the playlist.

You should ask regular viewers to join the room '%1$s' but the room operators can join the room '%1$s:%2$s' to automatically authenticate themselves.
